page.title: 01Ashington
page.content: {Ashington}is situated in West Sussex on the main{A.24}Horsham (10 miles) to Worthing (10 miles) road. It was mentioned in the original Domesday survey and until the end of the Second World War was a small village housing people mainly involved in farming. The village has developed in a linear fashion to the west of the main road. Today there is a{population}of nearly{1,700}but with proposed major development in the near future this figure might be raised to nearly 3,000. Many of the people living here today are either elderly or have employment outside the village. The village boundary covers an{area of about{2,314 acres}with nearly{500 {houses,}about{100}of which are owned by the local council authority.
